Reviews.Title: “Good for Paris, but still falls short of international standards”
Reviews.Author: examino
Reviews.Content: My rating is comparative to other Paris Hotels, against which the Baltimore is better than average. On the positive side, rooms have great beds and are immaculate with opulent linen, quality bathrooms with excellent amenities and finally the breakfast is excellent with some welcome differences to normal hotel choices, for example strawberry juice! Staff were uniformly efficient, helpful and very friendly. WiFi is complementary, which was welcome too. On the negative side, the rooms are small, but that's true for pretty much all Paris hotels (an unwelcome feature which makes stays awkward, and value seem poor). The TV and pay TV were a pretty old system and CNN and BBC World were intermittent. Paris hotels often have idiosynctratic quirks to their service, and on this stay I had a totally over persistent staff member knocking five times on my door at just before 10pm and then trying to let themselves in just to collect my room service tray! Unforgivable in my opinion, as I was in the shower and totally inappropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the average size rooms for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Duck_Cottage
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Baltimore hotel started with a very warm welcome from the reception staff. Helpful and courteous through out it made the check-in very simple. The rooms are typically small as are most hotels in Paris, however, it was bigger than most of this star rating I have stayed at in Paris. The decor through out has a very artistic feel about it and the design touches throughout make it feel like a boutique hotel. Facilities in the room are as standard per most hotels of this nature and there was very little external noise to keep you awake, which can be a problem in parts of most major cities. I also dined at the hotel, which offered a very good menu of typical well executed parisien cuisine. Service was good if a little slow at times, but then lingering over a good meal and a bottle of wine should not be complained about. The price overall was typical of this standard of hotel for Paris, but the service was definitely not Parisien, I mean that as a compliment.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a great little hotel - sadly no more..”
Reviews.Author: rachclaire
Reviews.Content: Having both lived in the neighborhood and stayed many times over the years even when it was a Westin, I went back - unfortunately, the rooms, service, everything but the location have all gone down.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and nice Hotel in a heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MoscowPavel
Reviews.Content: I spent only 1 night in June 2011. The location is perfect - avenue Kleber, 5 min to Trocadero. It's real Paris! The building is beautiful - have a look on it before enter! The room was nice, even more spacious than usually expected in Paris. Bed comfortable and big enough. Bathroom also match high level. Brakfast was excellent, good service. Appreciated. The only point - I was charged for my stay 2 times (once - upon booking, 2d - upon checkout). I wrote an e-mail to the hotel and it was fixed right away. I got a refund. Really reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: BazzaRugby
Reviews.Content: Only 75 metres from the nearest Metro [ Boisierre] and therefore so easy to get about whether in the day for sightseeing or for the nightlife. Only 5 min stroll from the Trocadero where you get a spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower. Hotel very clean & comfortable. Rooms small but with all you need. Staff very friendly & helpful. Excellent meal in the evening is available but expensive wine list.Good breakfast. When booked through Eurostar a good discount on their tariff prices. For a 2 or 3 day stay I would reccomend a Paris Pass for all the major tourist attractions - museums, art galleries, Eiffel Tower. Also get the Metro/RER/Bus ticket.These are quite costly but save you all the queuing at the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: indiantrotter
Reviews.Content: A cozy and comfortable hotel located in Central Paris. It is a 5 mins walk from Trocadero, the metro and Arc De Triumph. The hotel has a beautiful facade and clean rooms with spacious bathrooms. The rooms are small and it gets a bit difficult if travelling with 2 bags. The small rooms are the only negative bit, everything else is super.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: SQgolfer
Reviews.Content: A cozy and clean hotel with a great restaurant. Hotel is central - walking to Arch de Triumph and Tour Eiffel. A beautiful facade coupled with a great lobby / lounge area. Well lit rooms and very clean and spacious bathrooms. Helpful staff. Excellent breakfast. Bedrooms were a little small therefore more appropriate for a solo or a couple visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler053
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel is not right in the heart of the action in Paris, the slightly quieter Avenue Kleber is a nice place to stay. And if one is willing to walk or use the Metro, this location is very convenient. It is across the street from the M6 Boissiere stop but a quick walk to Charles de Gaulle Etoile and the Trocadero. The staff was extremely friendly, and there were a variety of restaurants nearby for breakfast or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: BHNZ
Reviews.Content: For the money paid and the classification of M-gallery I expect a lot more. Stars are obviously awarded for location and the pretty building. Staff are not what you expect from Mercure and did not want to help in any way. French are not friendly or service oriented anyway but a hotel of this style should have the few that are. I am an Accor Platinum member thanks to my work trips and am meant to be a VIP (not being elitist, but would hate to think how they treat others if I am meant to be special!) Booked the weekend here as a nice romantic getaway for my wife who loves Paris. The location is good near the Arc, Champs and Eiffel and the building is very beautiful and french in style. Inside the foyer is done nicey, due to the upscale restaurant in the back (pricey so didn't bother). The bar is nice but service is very slow....just put another barperson on! Spent a fortune on an upgrade to a junior suite, as a treat and to make the weekend nice. Had read a review that said these rooms look over the street and very parisian blah blah blah.....small room with a Nespresso (special mention in room description) that didn't even work, and staff wouldn't fix it. The view was off the aircon ducts out the back and the service area. Bed was ok, only 2-3 tv channels in English. I can only assume that this place is only good for someone wanting a good location. Get the cheapest room you can. For breakfast, don't bother with the restaurant- Croissants and Coffee from the cafe straight out the front door and turn left are fantastic. Dinner, turn right and about a 10-15 min walk to Trocadero has heaps.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value”
Reviews.Author: KeithC2
Reviews.Content: While I had great expectations of this hotel, it failed to meet them. I used Britsh air miles to book this hotel and would NEVER had paid their rack rate. Low on the value scale, this hotel is average at best, The room was nice, but small and nothing special and no free WIFI, although they claim to have it for 6 hours or something, it should be easy and accessable, which it is not. The breakfast was good but nothing special and a friend commented that "one would think in Paris they woud have good pastries everywhere" which this hotel has average at best. While the location is great for walking its not exactly close to any main metro lines and one must switch trains constantly to actually get anywhere. The service I found to be quite good especially with the staff in the daytime and the breakfast staff. Supposedly the restaurant has a Michelin Star i find the decor to be contrived and boring. I would stay here if the rate was about 300 Euro a night less then the rack rate advertised and prices seem to fluctuate based on where one books this hotel, which is standard.All in all, good service in the daytime, nothing special in the evening or at night, and great location. I would rent an apatment next time...

Reviews.Title: “Americans will be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: alsembrano
Reviews.Content: If u are American, u will be disappointed with this hotel. Hotel Baltimore proclaims itself as a 4 star international hotel but using American standards and comparing to American hotels, this place is nothing more than a fancy motel. The service is bad, really bad. The rooms are small, really tiny, like less than 150 square feet. And they call this a deluxe room! The entire place smells old, and not in a pleasant way. The location is very good but all else sucks. If u are American and u stay here, u will be disappointed! Shame on Costco Travel for choosing this place to be part of their network. Whomever approved this place at Costco should be fired! I'm here now and it's bad. I mean really bad. And did I mention the service was horrible? These French people do not know what world class service is. They have two inexperience girls working the front desk, and they really are not qualified to be interfacing with international folks.

Reviews.Title: “Will you pay for a stay that's wake up by renovation every morning?”
Reviews.Author: Hubs1
Reviews.Content: When hotel assign room for a 5 days stay leisure traveler, do they put into any considerstation that the customer needs a quite holiday? I was put in a room that right opposite a room that is under renovation. Every morning, I will defintiely be wait up by 9am and without fail that the renovation noise happens throughtout the day non-stop. For a holiday in Paris, this is last to be expect especially for the price that I pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect for the money. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Missy629
Reviews.Content: When we arrived staff were fast to attend to us and very courteous. We were escorted to our rooms, given a thorough tour in fluent English, room was spacious and beautifully decorated. Toiletries provided were great! Bathroom was beautifully decorated and the toilet was in a seperate room which was useful in a shared room. The shower was incredible. At no point our stay did we hear any noise from other rooms, it was very peaceful. There was a good size tv but only one news channel in English. The cocktail bar is lovely and quaint but as you would expect prices are high. I will likely use this hotel again when in Paris. Pricey but unbeatable location right next to the Avenue des Champs-Élysées for seeing the sights without crossing into the EXTREME price range like the Ritz e.t.c and a fantastic array of restaurants on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: toddhames
Reviews.Content: We drove to Paris to spend New Year's Eve in the City of Lights and were so happy to have made Hotel Baltimore Paris our home away from home. The location: You can literally walk three blocks in one direction and be at L'Arc de Triomphe or walk three blocks in the other direction and be at Place de Trocedero and gaze at the Eiffel Tour. Metros in either direction. Cafes all around you. Neighborhood shopping is a few blocks away on avenue Victor Hugo. The room: Our first room was a deluxe room with a king sized bed and the room was a decent size. However, when we asked to be moved as it was outside of the elevator, we were accomodated the next day with a complimentary upgrade to a Jr. Suite in a quieter area, perfect to protect the sleep of our toddler! The food: Our rate included a complimentary breakfast, which we could have had in our room or in the restaurant daily. We chose the restaurant and were treated to fantastic and accomodating service every morning. What a way to start the day. The food was good and if you wanted something, the chef would whip it up. The service: Arriving at night, we were happy to have our car whisked away to a secure parking location and to have our room ready for us. The service was great. We were well looked after... from the front desk, the bell captain, and the concierge, everyone was friendly and helpful. We were even give a recommendation to a nice restaurant nearby and were again impressed by the level of service. Overall, I see us staying here again during our next visit. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Andyaok
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff where very helpful and friendly. Hotel is a 10 min walk to effiel tower and 1 min from metro. Highly recommend breakfast at hotel it was perfect. Deals on eurostar for this hotel was great value as included breakfast. Def would go back to hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location. (Really) Small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: RogerFromBrazil
Reviews.Content: Paris hotel rooms are small. But these redined the concept. Could literally touch the walls if spreading my arms. That being said, the location is one of the best in Paris, with a short walk to Trocadero (best view of Eiffel Tower) and a convenient car valet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the staff were all excellent and handled problems efficiently. The hotel is well located with lots of good local restaurants and the rooms are comfortable. On the negative side, rooms are small and we had a persistent heating problem. Although the issue was solved, not all staff seemed to know how the heating system was operated. We also had a problem with drain smells - sorted out efficiently by a room change, plus a drinks voucher as an apology. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2 days”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 7h00 am in the morning. We had an upgrade and we were given our room at 8h00 am. The room was spacious and excellent in all features except the view to the internal court with Air condition machineries. The bed is very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and rich in fruits and healthy options. Location just a few meters from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Well-situated boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ueser
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in this hotel located between the Arc de Triomphe & Eiffel Tower, a very convenient location, near several Metro stops. The 16th arondissement is a nice residential part of the city with many dining options. Our only complaints with the hotel were: rooms & bathrooms are small (typical for Euro hotels), dimly lit bedroom, and very little shelf or drawer space for clothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice furnishings”
Reviews.Author: breanneg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when the Tour de France road into Paris this summer. Pros: *The place was very centrally located in Paris with easy access to all of the major sites. *The furniture and decor was simple but nice. *The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge was super great helping us figure out how to get to places. *There's a yummy takeout pizza place across the street. Great for an inexpensive dinner. I think it's called Rabbit or Bunny something. *It's clean. Cons: *The first evening there were 3 instances where a housekeeper walked into our room without knocking. Luckily we were decent all times, but it was very awkward. *Every day we put the "do not disturb" sign on our door so that they wouldn't come in and make our bed, but every day when we got back our room had been made up. *Our room smelled like cigarettes. Our window opened up to a small private courtyard, so I think maybe it was from people smoking out there, but every day when we'd return the cigarette smell was very noticeable. Overall, I would stay here again because of the nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tina H
Reviews.Content: Didnt pay for hotel so can't comment on price, but the location is great only 10mins from the Eiffel Tower, can walk down to the river, that takes you everywhere. Xmas markets were on & it is a magical time to be in Paris. The hotel is quiet boutique, rooms are small but have everything you need. Staff are very friendly and so helpful, speak good English which sounds bad but is a problem if you don't speak French like me There is a lovely Bistro just left of the hotel, best onion soup I've had.

Reviews.Title: “short stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one day short business trip in Paris. The hotel location is one of the best I've experienced in Paris, walking distance to Champs-Elysees and Eiffel Tower. There are also many excellent restaurants in the neighborhood. The room is relatively small, like many hotel in Paris but nicely furnished and the bathroom is modern which was a big relief for me. The breakfast was very nice with excellent selection of bread, pastries, and yogurts.

Reviews.Title: “Paris 4 day stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall I suppose the hotel is OK but there are a number of little things that need attention I think housekeeping need to lift their game as on a daily basis there were things that either didnt get done very well or not at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & location for exploring a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, comfortable beds, romantic decor and cosy rooms, walking distance of eiffel tower, champs elysee, seine boat cruises, patisseries, bars, restaurants. Recommended for a romantic stay in paris especially.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant change from some of the better known Parisian hotels”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near Trocadero. Not quite a boutique hotel, but has a boutique feel. 2 metro stops from Etoile, and has a nice neighbourhood feel, with some good bars and cafes nearby. Not the cheapest, but reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take the prepaid meal in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On check-in was advised that my room booking included dinner in the restaurant (which i was not aware of). Decided to have dinner there and was very disappointed. Was treated very poorly by the waiter, was told the dinner consisted of an entree, main and desert and was then asked if I wanted the meat or the fish. No explanation of what the dinner consisted of at all. Had to request a drink as it seemed like no one wanted to serve me as i had the prepaid dinner and would only want the one glass of wine that went with the dinner. The meal was dissapointing and the service was worse. Wish I had not taken up the offer of the meal and had visited another restaurant. This experience has tainted my view of the Mecure Baltimore and I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mother Daughter First trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sharon B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and located perfectly for us. The Metro was a block away and so convenient to use. Cafes in the area were excellent.We read many reviews about the hotel and the complaints about the room size but we found that for us it was fine. I would recommend anyone going to Paris to stay there and we would stay there again. The staff was exceptional and an asset to the company. We could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The turning area in front of the hotel was occupied throughout our stay by Accor Hotel management staff. This made arriving and departing by car or taxi difficult. Not good for customer relations!!! The refurbishment of the hotel is installing more showers than baths in the bathrooms and this restricts the choice of rooms. The hotel staff were very welcoming and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “first trip to paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel great and perfect location,drinks in hotel bar very expensive if in paris again would want to stay in this hotel, staff were very helpful and friendly.one thing I would say is rooms are very small so be sure to book larger rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but could improve bathroom & room service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was according to standards except for the gutter smell in the bathroom, which they told us couldn't be helped (?) Room service was not correct since room was not vacuumed & amenities where not refilled for the 2nd day (coffee/tea, not enough soap, etc) Fitness below standard and also here no facilities to clean installations after usage. Personnel was very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Awful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: craysnancy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. It is a short walk to the Trocadero and a Metro station is nearby. There are numerous brasseries within a few blocks of the hotel. The restaurant is small, but nicely decorated. Dinners were excellent but pricey. The room we were given was very small. We inquired about an upgrade, but they said this was an upgrade. The bed was very small. I guess it was a double. It was a challenge to find room for our two suitcases without stacking them on top of one another. There was not a single drawer in the room. If there had been drawers, one of us could have put some clothes in it and we could have stacked the suitcases or simply closed one and put it on end behind a door. The room had a very small closet area, a safe and mini bar. They should get rid of the mini bar and put in drawers. They should replace the bed tables with nightstands that have drawers or shelves. The bathroom was tiny with no counter space. There was a small shelf under the washbowl where they put the towels. We removed the towels and put them in various other places, including on top of my suitcase. Then we put our bathroom items on the shelf. The toilet was separate. There was a shower only, no bathtub. We didn't have any strong odor as others have reported. Sometimes I smelled a slight odor like mold or mildew in the bathroom, but I could see none. It must have come from the drains I guess. We were in 414. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. However, on our last night there, while we were at dinner, one of them stole a large box of expensive chocolates from a famous chocolatier in Dijon that we had placed in the minibar. We reported this and received an apology, but that did not get us the chocolates or our money. Our other complaint is that our room usually didn't get cleaned up until 5:00 p.m. or later. It was at a time when we wanted to clean up before dinner. There was no room for the maid and us in the room at the same time, so we had to go downstairs in the reception area to wait for her to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in October”
Reviews.Author: Debra M Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel baltimore is nicely located near a subway stops. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in their recommendations of restaurants and directions to museums reminding us of when they are closed and that on the first Sunday of the month there are many museums that are free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milnnyl
Reviews.Content: My friend went Paris for job training, so I stayed with her at the Baltimore for good 2 weeks. The hotel has great location, quick walk to Trocadero where you can sit at the park and enjoy the magnificent view of Eiffel Tower and 10 mins walk to Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe. The first room we got was on the 6th floor. The room was tiny and we were pretty sure that we didn't get a king-sized bed as booked but the porter insisted it was! Then there was a BAD sewage ordour. As it got more and more unbearable, we had to call the receiption to send someone to check out the problem. They move us to another room on the 5th floor, this time it's a real king-sized bed! The room is bigger but late into the night, we still experience some bad ordour from the bathroom. Although it's less severe this time, the room was bearable if we close the bathroom door. First week went past quite well. Second week in Paris, weather has turned hotter. We started to notice that the aircon was not working well at night. We made a complaint about the aircon at the receiption before we head out in the morning, the aircon control was adjusted but no mention of what the problem was when we are back at the hotel. On our last 3 nights staying in the hotel, the room got so warm at night that we have to leave the window open to let some cool fresh air in. Of course both of us didn't rest well from the hustle and bustle outside.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with fantastic room. Nicely furnished, large bathroom, room had a safe and free wifi. Eiffel tower was just around the corner, and a short walk to a bus hopper stop that took you to all the major museums.

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE !!”
Reviews.Author: bunnyswippers
Reviews.Content: Husband and I checked in with anticipation of being treated as we were at the Marriott on our last trip to Paris. Had we not paid for the room in advance we would have left. The room we were given was tiny, at the back of the hotel down a corridor, small window no view, dirty and wallpaper falling off the walls and an awful odor. We asked to have our room changed, which they did but to something worse. Not much cleaner, still the odor, and had an attic type ceiling. We had to take turns walking around the room it was so small and my husband had to duck down to crawl into bed and he hit his head a few times. Our experience with staff at the desk was awful. We stayed 3 nights at $500.00 a night and detested going back to the horrible room and dealing with the people at the desk because it was such an unpleasant experience. The only thing good about this hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights at the Baltimore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevlee2022
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Baltimore for our first trip to Paris. Lovely Hotel, a quick 5 min walk down to the Trocadero and 10 mins to Arc de Triomphe. Hotel close to some lovely restaurants and brassieres. The room was a little small but nicely furnished with lovely french doors opening onto a small verandah overlooking the Avenue Kleber. The rooms were serviced every day and were very clean. The beds had a pillow topper that made you feel like you were in a lovely soft nest. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were very tasty and well set up.

Reviews.Title: “paris hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: lindalockhouse
Reviews.Content: have just returned from hotel baltimore - we had a very pleasant trip and this hotel was clean comfortable and very convenient for the eiffel tower and champs elysee. we upgraded to a deluxe room and were upgraded again to a junior suite which was lovely if a little dark - more lamplight is needed. also tv very limited channels unless paid for which we felt a bit expensive but overall the breakfast was fresh and varied and would recommend this hotel to anyone especially for its very polite and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay in the 16 arr't”
Reviews.Author: bbanks945
Reviews.Content: Hotel Baltimore is an Accor property near Le Trocadero, right across from Metro La Bossiere. The rooms are standard Parisian - small. Oddly, my room was a split level, with the wc at the top of the stairs and the sink and bath at the bottom. The Baltimore is nicely decorated. The restaurant is very good. I found it quiet and everything was dependable, except the wireless, which was a bit wonky. The bed was first class and the linens all excellent. It's worth it to stay in this neighborhood just to be able to make a morning and evening walk around Le Trocadero and then down to the Eiffel Tower. Also, rue Passy has some very nice shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--top floor had a sewage odor”
Reviews.Author: kroo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Baltimore for a conference I attended in August. The room (on the 6th floor) I was given was clean, comfortable and reasonably sized. All the amenities worked well. The included breakfast was good, though not worth the 26 euros they charged if it were not included. But every evening a sewage odor would come into the room around 10 p.m. and permeate the hallway. It was not from our bathroom, or outside of the building, so I can only hypothesize that something was wrong with the plumbing in general. After 2 nights, I could not stand the horrid smell anymore. I asked to be moved to another room, and rather than apologies, I was told that they had no idea what this problem was, and that I should not have waited 2 days to complain, and that there were no rooms available for me to move to. A few hours later they found another room for me, but the experience soured me on this hotel, especially since I spoke to another colleague who told me that in a prior trip a few weeks earlier, she had complained to management about the exact same problem on a 6th floor hotel room right next to mine. Not the quality I expected from an Accor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: At first, this hotel is very well situated, just between the Eiffel tower and the Arc de Triomphe (Champs Elysées), in front of a bus stop, at 50 m of the netro station. There is no parking at the hotel itself, but you give your keys and a chauffeur takes care of it.Room are very well sound isolated and the breakfast buffet is very complete. We stayed there with a few friends and they were very kind to allow us to enjoy it in a separate dining room : super! Service personnel was extremely kind. In a word : a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “The right choice !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research we picked the Hotel Baltimore mainly because of its location. Overall we made the right choice. This is as first class as you can get for 372 Euros a night. The room, although predictably small, was clean and comfortable. Great beds, pillows and comforters ! The staff was kind, helpful and caring. We didn't try the restaurant because we heard it was pricey and there are so many other options out there anyway but it looked extremely nice too. the bar was small but the service was great. The location was everything we expected - close the arche de triomphe, eifel tower and the trocadero square area, and we felt safe even late at night. I would stay here agin. No complaints !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 609x
Reviews.Content: Near Arch and Eiffel , great place for kids. We caught the hop on bus nearby, so close to everything. Would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “One member of staff ruined a special night!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: caroline40
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, check in was easy and reception staff were lovely. Arrived at our room, typical French size but very nice and just recently refurbished. Quick drop off bags and out to find a local cafe/bistro for lunch. After a walk around we headed back to hotel to get ready to go out for dinner. I had noticed there was no hairdryer in the room just before we went out but as I didn't intend using it before dinner it was no big deal. On arrival back at hotel around 11pm we asked the reception staff for a hairdryer and were told it may not be possible for that night but to try in the morning. I'd said I intended washing my hair before bed and didn't want the hassle of trying again to get a hairdryer to my room. We said we'd have a drink in the bar and come back to reception to pick up the hairdryer. We headed to our room and my husband called down to reception and spoke with the man on duty (Javier), who told my husband he'd already said we would not get it till the morning. My husband went down to reception to see them and find out what the problem was and when he was speaking with girl on duty, the guy was muttering and swearing under his breath. When my husband challenged him on this he got very agressive when my husband asked for his name. He said "i'm not giving you my fu**ing name and was shouting at my husband. Never in all our years travelling have we received this arrogance, rudness and aggressive attitude from anyone. All we wanted was a hairdryer, which should have been in the room anyway. My husband asked for the manager and this awful man on reception said there were no managers. My husband went to the resaurant and spoke with the manager there who was shocked to hear what had just happened, as were several other guests who were standing around at the time. We got the hairdryer at that point. The following morning my husband spoke with the Manager, who was not aware of the incident and said he would offer something to us in the way of compensation that day. Compensation was an insulting 10% off our first night stay, 18 euros. This hotel fit the bill as per the other reviews, but why would anyone want to be abused by a member of staff in this manner????

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good price”
Reviews.Author: postboxsumit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with our two kids at Baltimore. It’s a small boutique hotel located in the heart of the city. Five minutes walk on either side of the road leads to Champ Elysees or Eifel Tower. It’s very convenient to come back to your room for a quick rest before heading out again. Hotel staff is extremely courteous, friendly and helpful. Rooms are very small and can accommodate at best two persons, we took two connecting rooms. Right next to the hotel is small Carrefour city market, several cafes, Asian restaurants, so none of the days we used hotel restaurants. We ordered milk for our baby in the mid night and some time very early in the morning and room service was very quick and courteous. They also offer free wi-fi unlike most hotels in Paris charge unreasonable amount for Internet.I checked other hotels in the same area and this was probably the best deal we got for two connecting rooms. We loved our stay at Baltimore, Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quality + Location = A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: emosnj
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my wife and our 17 year old and 12 year old. The rooms were small of course, but very very nice. They gave us two rooms that were not connected but shared a common private hallway with its own door so we could turn it into a sort of suite. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were very nice. Shower was super. Service was very good. Everything was very clean. The staff were all very polished and professional. The breakfast was well done - very French. We had previously been to Paris and stayed in the St. Germain area. That's close to ND and is a nice place to stay, but I wanted something different, closer to the Eiffell Tower. The Hotel Baltimore is in a great locatoin on the west side of the city. It's about 7-10 minute walk to Arch D' Triomphe and about 12-15 minute walk to Eiffell Tower. And there's a convenient metro station very near hotel. Goood restaurants nearby also. And it's in pretty quiet but safe area. If the location makes sense for your trip's needs, then I think you woul have a hard time finding a better choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: CapertonGC
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough nice things about this recently rebranded hotel. Been in the same spot with the same name for a long time, but now Accor has it as something called MGallery. Accor keeps fiddling with its properties and doubtless there's method in the madness. At least in this case they certainly got it right. We had a junior suite and while you can't call it inexpensive, it seemed reasonable to us and was very comfortable. Metro is across the street and the Trocadero is a few minutes walk. We checked out around midday and left the car with them until the early evening. As promised, it was out of the garage and waiting for us when we return. That was nice. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: bacsoup
Reviews.Content: We got 2 rooms: 2 double and a triple. The bathroom were big. Good wifi signal. Right next to Arce de Triomphe metro. The staff was great, helpful & resourceful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel since there are many cafe, brassier nearby. We enjoyed our stay. We would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “FAB HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: drobnik
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel in 16th just around the corner from the trocadero/eifel tower, i guess as it was august we were up-graded to a junior suite which made for a spacious room for an inner city hotel. staff were very helpful and we liked the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bond077
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Baltimore for 3 nights and were very impressed by the warm and friendly service, the huge included breakfast and the great location close to both the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. The rooms, although small were well appointed with quality furnishings and an excellent rain shower. There is a fitness area and business centre, intimate bar and a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “very comfy and well located”
Reviews.Author: ParisCharlie Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very close to the Champs-Elysées and the Eiffel Tower this hotel is a really nice and comfortable place to stay. One minor disappointment though : you have to pay to get access to the Internet if you don't have your own laptop (which would work with free WiFi).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: monketteDouglasIOM
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with my husband who was there with work colleagues for 3 nights.The hotel was really lovely.I am not really a breakfast eater but it was lovely and light hams cheese , tomatoes etc although hubbie just had coffee and juice.There is a small gym which I tried to use but it didn't appear to have air conditioning.The room was spotless and the location was very central for all the tourist attractions.We plan to go back next year for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JillChester
Reviews.Content: Ideal location between Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower, only steps to Metro and on Open Top bus route. Staff very helpful, efficient and polite, public spaces, clean, inviting, room decent size, large bed, crisp clean sheets, duvets and pillows good quality, abundant hot water, towels changed morning and night. We didn't eat in restaurant as closed Sunday and Monday but lovely restaurant nearby (turn left from side door of hotel to top of street, left again and it is just on left ). Many other restaurants round about too, the concierge was extremely helpful. The hotel menu didn't appeal to us in any case but we could well be wrong. Breakfast was good, my only complaint would be that the cooked option was not readily apparent, it was only because we saw somebody else order it that we knew it existed, but the cold buffet was adequate and abundant ( fruit, yoghurts, cerelas, meat, cheeses, bread, pastries etc.) We would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Baltimore and found everything to be expected at this class of hotel. The location is is great, close to the Eiffel tower and the open top bus tours there, close to the shopping of Champ de Ulysses and of course the Arch de Triumphe. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Neilanddot
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get a better, nicer, more perfect hotel to base ourselves for our stay in Paris. The room, although small, was excellent and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very modern facilities and the staff were very efficient, warm and welcoming. The location is excellent for discovering Paris. The room that we had however, whilst clean, modern and functional, was only suitable for a single person. You should not have to have one person staying in bed while the other has a shower and dress because of lack of space. Avoid room 514 and the ilk.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute class”
Reviews.Author: daphne_blake Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite for 4 days in early june as part of a family holiday... The room was beautiful with almost a full view of the eiffel tower... but this was merely the icing on the cake as the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room beautiful, breakfasts were great, and the location is fantastic. To be honest at the beginning of our holiday we stayed at an m gallery hotel in zurich and were horribly disappointed so we werent expecting much, but the baltimore surprised us. I treally is a very nice hotel and i will absolutely look at staying there again when our family next visit the lovely city of paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and functional”
Reviews.Author: ehsfb2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and adequate for a stay with smallish rooms but th ebest feature is its location. I had anticipated spending a lot of money on cabs but we walked everywhere. The Arc du Triomp is a 10 minute walk as is the Eifel Tower. The Champs Elysses is adjacent to the Arc du Triomph. The Hotel les Invalides is only slightly farther as is the Concord. We were even going to walk to Notre Dame which would ave been maybe 45 minutes to an hour but we took the hop on hop off boats on the Seine next to the Eifel Tower which hit every one of these spots so you're a few minutes away. Only th eArc is off the river and it's only about 15 min. off the Eiffel stop. The one day pass was 14 Euros I think. Breakfast was pretty good and room service was prompt. The general Parisien attitude of aloofness was present but that's everywhere. The bed was like sleeping on a pillow ( too soft ) but that might appeal to some. The internet connection was good. It's a 12 Euro ride from the Nord train station.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: Ft9883
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days and the air conditioner did not work during the whole of my stay. A "technician" was sent up on the first 3 days (by the 4th I just gave up). It was always a different person. Each of them pressed the buttons on the remote and assured me that they had fixed it. But the reality was they had no idea why it was not working. Each changed the settings arount ending up exactly where they had started and the aircontiditioner continued to just circulate warm air. On each night we had to sleep with the window open. Staff gave me the feeling that I was being taken for a fool. The best thing that can be said about his hotel is that it is in a very good loacation and it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “great location and wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bsbn
Reviews.Content: The highlight is the location - close to Eiffel Tower and Arc de Trimphe. The buffet breakfast is a delight with a wide selection of everything to expect from a full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the place, the staff (room service included) was really helpful, fast. The bed was exceptionnal, the bathroom a little bit small but the room was really big and well decorated. Location: approximately 10-15 minutes walk from Place de l'Etoile.

Reviews.Title: “A Michelin starred restaurant?- they cannot be serious!!!”
Reviews.Author: peterdeculcheth
Reviews.Content: A very corporate hotel lacking in style and personality. Good location midway between the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. Although we were on the 3rd floor, street noise kept us awake at night. Concierge and reception staff were fine, but oh dear, - the restaurant. It is claimed to have a Michelin star. Either Michelin are lowering their standards, or more likely management is not exercising sufficient attention and control. Drinks ordered were first forgotten and then the wrong ones brought; the sommelier had his head so much up his own cul that after the initial tasting of the wine, he was never seen again and we were left to pour our own. Plates were cold, and had obviously been waiting to be plated up so that some parts of the dish were cold, and others warm at best. The food itself lacked imagination and its execution and presentation was ordinary. The staff should be ordered to spend an evening round the corner at Restaurant Victor to see how it should be done.

Reviews.Title: “June stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Baltimore is in a nice location in Paris. It is convenient to the subway. The hotel itself is nice, but the rooms can be small. The furnishings are nice, but some things might not be in he best working condition. For example the soap dish on the wall of the shower was not firmly installed and the door to our room was jammed one afternoon. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived around 6pm and we opted to wait which was a bad idea because the 15 minute estimate by the front desk turned into a 30 minute wait. Other than that, the hotel is nice. The rooms on the days we stayed were expensive according to the price list displayed a the lobby, but we paid about half what was posted since we booked early online. This was the French Open weekend.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING - HOTEL STAFF INCOMPETENT”
Reviews.Author: CORCO55
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Baltimore Hotel from 20th - 24th April 2011. The hotel itself is in a great location and our suite on the 5th floor had a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. From the first day the air conditioning did not work and on 7 occasions over the next three days I complained. The second and subsequent days they sent a technician to the room to fix the problem but on each occasion it was the same technician. This person could not speak a word of english and informed management on each occasion that the air conditioning worked perfectly. On the third day he set the thermostat on 30 degrees and we thought that the control must have been working in the opposite direction until we started to swelter. Management then accused us of setting the thermostat on 30 degrees and that it was our fault.. On the forth day we had to physically drag a manager by the name of Michelle to the room to show him the difference in temperature between the hotel hallway outside our door and our room. Finally we got recognition that there was a problem. For our 4 day stay we have to sleep with the windows open to get some relief from the hot room. With the noise from the street sleeping was poor. The management on checking out admitted full liability for our discomfort and offered a lousy 10% off the hotel account. The hotel is lovely but if you don't want to be laughed at behind your back and treat like a fool give this hotel a miss. Value for money was poor at about AUD500 per night..

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay - still very good”
Reviews.Author: The_Thib Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect (not far from the Champs-Elysées), and easy access (metro and RER). Value for money is good and rooms are nice. Breakfast is quite good even if variety of food could be enhanced. This was my second stay and it is a place to recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: deepalikapoor
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location it is very close to Trocadero and Champs de élysées .the staff is very helpful and polite and take great care that you are comfortable. Check in facilities are without delays and they don't keep you waiting after a long flight. The concierge was helpful. The only downside were their small rooms

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vk167 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and the hotel is comfortable, neat and very well done up. Though, at more than 200 euros per day, it appeared to be somewhat expensive. The staff was responsive even on a sunday and late at night. It is surrounded by excellent eateries.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Adore the Hotel Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Lunarboogie
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the free wifi in my room. It is our fifth night out of a 7-day baby-moon in the city of light and we couldn't be happier. This place is an oasis of comfort and relaxation in a busy part of Paris. We're staying in a delux room that is large, even by indulgent Asian standards. Ours faces a side street, so is whisper quiet. It even has a gorgeous Juliet balcony from which to see the street scape below. We ummed and ahhed before booking and relied entirely on reviews from Trip Adviser. I am happy to say that the positive accounts are all vindicated. So much so, the New Zealand Prime Minister, John Key, stayed a few doors down from us which says it all really. We didn't even know he was there until I bumped into him at breakfast. If it is good enough for the Head of Government, than it will certainly be good enough for you. I think it caters mainly for business clientelle but don't let that put you off. We have been very impressed with this place and would stay again in a heart beat. It is opposite a metro station (Boisserie) and a Carrefour is only 20 metres away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNomad62
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at this hotel and it was fantastic, booked a junior suite and it was nice and roomy, come with free internet and espresso machine. The hotel is close to a supermarket and several good restaurants, plus the metro is across the road. A good stay and I would recommend the Baltimore for people wanting a central hotel in a quiet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly staff with a 4 star hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My son and I were spending 11 days in Paris and wanted a 4 star hotel, without the huge bill. I preferred to use the saved bucks for dining, museums, touring, and shopping. There is not a huge breakfast buffet like the Westin Paris, but it was nice. It gave an opportunity to also eat breakfast at the wonderful nearby cafes. The location is near the Arc de Triumph (?) and Champs Elysee, a little bit of a walk to museums, but there are nearby metros. A great hotel for vacationers who have already been to Paris previouls, and don't , mind a bit of a walk to get to the museums. A great way to walk off the calories anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 nights at Hotel Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about booking at Hotel Baltimore based on the photos of the rooms on TripAdvisor that some people posted. There was no need for the concern though. The interior of the hotel is lovely and I had a very good stay at Hotel Baltimore. The location is great: from the airport I took the train and subway to and from the hotel. Its approximately a 1 hour - give yourself 90 minutes just to be safe. My room was lovely, although rather small. Breakfast was fabulous: many options, excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I go very often in Paris and I found the place where I like to stay. The welcome is friendly without being too obsequious. The hotel is ideally placed and rooms are "decent sized" for Paris. The only area for improvement is the price of breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel 15 minutes walk from Arc De Triomphe and Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: StuartP1962
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore is ideally sited just 100 metres walk from Bossiere Metro station, which makes journeys to any part of Paris very simple. If you prefer to walk, you can get to the Arc de Triomphe/Champs-Elysees area in 15 minutes in one direction from the hotel and the Trocadero/Eiffel Tower area in 10-20 minutes in the other direction. Whilst the hotel has a pricey one star Michelin Restaurant of it's own there are numerous other restaurants within walking distance which offer everything from simple French Cuisine, Bistros, Fine Dinning to Chinese/Thai, all at a more reasonable price. The hotel easily justifies its 4 star rating with excellent facilities and extremely friendly and helpful staff. We were upgraded to a deluxe room on our arrival and throughly enjoyed our stay, especially the breakfasts in the beautifully decorated restaurant. We have been to Paris 4 times and will ceratinly visit again, booking into the Baltimore again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in a central location for all the main sites in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PotatoExpert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the last week of January . The reception were very welcoming on arrival and explained the services within the hotel . Our double room was comfortable and fronted onto a side street which meant the room was very quite and peaceful for sleeping . Good beds and nice linen . We ate lunch in the restaurant on the day of arrival for convenience . The food was excellent and whilst the price was high it was more than made up for by the high standard of service . Breakfast was included in the deal and again the quality of the food and choice was very good indeed . Location was perfect with main sites such as the Eiffel Tower and the Arc De Triomphe within easy walking distance . A metro station Boissiere was just across the road from the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Price Value Expectations not met”
Reviews.Author: redwrangler8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Baltimore MGallery is a 103 room hotel located right in the center of Paris and is withing walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysee. It has an ideal location for sightseeing and exploring Paris. The hotel is elegant and the check-in staff was friendly and efficient. The Baltimore has a small bar and a restaurant. The fitness facility is quite small with one treadmill, one stationary bike and a weight machine. During my stay the treadmill was readily available and the fitness room did not appear to be overcrowded. The rooms are very small, but then this is a given in Paris, and follow an elegant and a bit plush style. The room amenities provided meet the expectations of a hotel in this class, offering bath robe, slippers, mini-bar and internet access (for fee). No iron or ironing board though. What cleanliness is concerned the rooms get a definite minus though. The bathroom was plainly filthy and unacceptable for a €250 charge per night. Even though the style of the room followed the elegant theme of the hotel, it was worn and there were signs of usage everywhere (chipped furniture, which then is no surprise given the small size of the room). The water adjustments in the shower and bathroom sink required very fine motoric skill in order to reach an appropriate temperature. The chaulking in the bathroom was also disgusting (and I am not coy). The bed was great though with the nice feature to have a quilt underneath the bedsheet, which made sleeping there almost like resting in a cloud. The breakfast buffet was decent, but at €26 totally overpriced. The restaurant staff in the morning was a bit indifferent and required approaching them rather than being serviced. Once asked the service was fine though. To end on a positive note, I want to point out that the bell staff was great, kind and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: georgereid
Reviews.Content: At €300 per room not including breakfast, I thought this hotel was a little expensive. But the rooms weren't cramped like a lot of other places in Paris and the location proximate to the subway, Trocadero Place and the Champs-Elysee was very good. If you stay here, I strongly recommend venturing toward Avenue Victor Hugo where you will find beautiful patisseries, boulangeries, delis, fruit shops, butchers, seafood shops and poultry shops that locals actually use - in quite a few of those shops the English spoken by shopkeepers will be minimal at best, but the produce is beautiful. Reception was very friendly, as was concierge - in particular a young man named Serge. None of the staff were rude, but one particular concierge, Jamal, was a little lazy when we sought advice from him. Staff rush to take suitcases from you when they see you entering the door, and often also run to the entrance just to open the door for you. One other thing also worth mentioning is that someone would knock on our door in the evening offering to refill tea and coffee, sugar, etc, and also offered chocolates and shortbread from La Nottré - which is a nice service!

Reviews.Title: “paris holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the bed was excellent and big for our baby to sleep in the middle and the room and hotel is the best we have stayed in for a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruffollins
Reviews.Content: Our daughter recently got married in Perth, Australia and were coming to the end of their honeymoon in Europe, when we decided to surprise them by secretly arriving at their hotel in Paris. After we booked in we asked our receptionist Candice to find an excuse to bring our daughter & her husband down to the foyer so that we could surprise them. This was done with extreme care and our daughter broke down into tears when seeing her mother standing in front of her. Tears were also shed by the reception staff as well. The help in getting around through the snow from all of the staff was exemplary. Accor must be congratulated for employing such caring staff who were always helpful. The restaurant staff were also very obliging and their service was second to none. The room we had was very comfortable and if visiting Pari again, we will definitely choose Hotel Baltimore. Thankyou (Merci Beaucoup) to ALL of the staff at Hotel Baltimore for their welcome. Clive & Therese

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in heart ofParis”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Baltimore in December 2010. Friendly staff, good rooms if not too big. The hotel is centrally located near subway station: Bossière. The service at breakfest needs some improving but overall service was very good, especially the concierge. Definitely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Travelled with my picky Mom and her best friend - Hotel 100% approved!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie13London
Reviews.Content: It's not easy to get my mom's approval on hotels but this charming place made us all happy. Modern, well-proportioned (for Europe) rooms. Very clean and smelled great thanks to their candles. I have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet room, otherwise just OK”
Reviews.Author: londongirl44
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, large size for Paris & looked recently decorated, which was odd since the bathroom was old fashioned and grubby! Room very quiet at night despite central location - 5-10 min walk from main sites. Breakfast was just ok - I was here with work and would not have paid €300+ per night to stay here - would recommend the secret hotel in Paris (see my other reviews) as much better value for money

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous little hotel in a brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: SunshineCoasting
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel, about 100 rooms, right in the heart of everything. Located so centrally, you walk out the front door turn left and in a few minutes you are the Arc de Triomphe or head right and you are at Trocadero looking at the majestic Eiffel Tower from Palais de Chaillot. There is a Metro station right across the road, Boissiere, which makes getting further afield very easy. The hotel had a great little restaurant open for breakfast and dinner. Not sure about lunch as we were never there during the day. The concierge staff were extremely helpful booking us drivers, confirming restaurant reservations and anything else we asked them to do. The rooms were compact but in a city like Paris you are not lying around in your room, you are out checking out the sites so it was more than ample. The only down part was that it was a little noisy. We were on the first floor and were woken each morning by a noise that we could not work out what it was. Didn't really worry us too much as it was as good as a wake up call to get us going for the day. Too much to see and do to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Rude rude staff”
Reviews.Author: eli014
Reviews.Content: In December 2008 I went to this hotel with my Mum booking rooms well in advance and requesting connecting rooms (Mum is not that much young anymore and I wanted to give a look at her anytime) underlining this request twice. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that all the connecting rooms were sold out but that we had been given superior rooms. I told the receptionist that I didn't give a damn about superior rooms but I did wanted connecting rooms as per my booking. She replied that all those rooms were sold out since midday so I'd better not bother her with discussion, Again I specified that connecting rooms were confirmed in the booking and again she repeated not to bother her with discussion. At this point I walked out the door, took my car, drove around the neighbor and found a wonderful hotel with connecting rooms. I went back to the Baltimore, canceled the booking without paying an euro (and they didn't say a word about it), greeted them and told them they would never see us again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ChatVoyageur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel this summer and I really enjoyed it! The location is great! just 15 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe! And just in front of the hotel there's a subway station and several brasseries where you can eat at a reasonable price! The room is bright with a really nice balcony facing Kleber Av and the bed is very comfy! Most hotels in Paris have small beds, but this one was a king size bed! The bathroom is ok but I found the tub too high for some people to step over comfortably. Hotels in Paris are overpriced and are not as nice as this one! It worth staying in! For a romantic break is great! I would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbnjgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long trip to Paris. Hotel Baltimore is a very comfortable and stylish hotel. We enjoyed an incredible breakfast each morning of our stay, with scrambled eggs that were elevated to an art form. The hotel has free wifi, a bar and Michelin rated restaurant. The location is fantastic, close to the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Trimophe and my personal favorite, action hero Jason Bourne's Paris apartment located at 104 Avenue Kleber. There are several local restaurants nearby and one in the hotel. I did not eat dinner at the hotel. I did eat at Cafe Kleber and Rallye Etoile. I enjoyed them both. There is also a market around the corner for cheap drinks and snacks. Just half a block away there is metro stop Boisierre which makes traveling a snap. Honestly, I was terrified to take the Paris subway at first for fear of getting lost. It was a snap much easier to navigate than the NY subway system. While at Hotel Baltimore we also used the concierge service. I found the concierge to be most helpful in getting dinner reservations at Chez Robert & Louise and helping us to track down a power converter after we realized we bought the wrong one in preparation for the trip. The only reason that I gave the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because one day the maid service didn't finish making the bed while we were out (it looked as if she were called away hurriedly and forgot to return.) Also, the hotel was working on it's pipes while we were there and there was no water usage between 10 AM and 3 PM for several days. It never caused us any problem as were out and about but nonetheless it's inconvenient. Overall, this is a great hotel and we plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for making Paris feel like home....”
Reviews.Author: Worlddiva10
Reviews.Content: After spending all night reviewing trip advisor reviews, I found this hotel. It stood out because it happened to share the same name as my hometown. The location was perfect...a few blocks to the Eiffel Tower, tons of restaurants, and shopping. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout my 3 night stay. They helped me find the latest bar/lounge spots, assisted me with booking Moulin Rouge show tickets and helped me with anything I needed throughout my stay. As a female traveling on my own for this trip (my travel buddy backed out at the last minute) they made me feel safe and welcomed throughout my entire stay. They even took the time to ensure that I made it in safely each night. Although a little pricey in my book, the hotel lived up to its trip advisor reviews. The bed was very comfortable, the service was excellent and tv/internet worked perfectly. Although I loved waking up and watching the sunrise above me on the balcony, the direct view from the balcony was another building.I would definitely stay at this hotel when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay. Staff very effective...”
Reviews.Author: mguven
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Staff very effective and friendly. Could not fault the service and the location is great. Our room was due some attention; cracked tiles in the bathroom and no chest of drawers, minor points if addressed in time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Georgetrotter
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a good first experience for my son. We took the Metro from Charles de Gaulle and the line en route provides quite a breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. It is within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe and Trocadero, the latter being a great spot for taking pictures of the tower. It is very easy to get around from this location and has lots of good places to eat, whether you are looking for fine dining or an informal dinner. The staff was generally nice and helpful. There was one gentleman at the front desk who neither smiled or greeted guests the whole time we were there but this did not put us off and overall we enjoyed all the amenities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet location with views of Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: rvansam
Reviews.Content: we had two adjoining rooms with a door to the hallway so we could leave our individual room doors open. The rooms were huge with little balconies that we could step out on. From there we had views of the top 1/3rd of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is on Ave Kleber with Boissere metro right across the street. 5 minutes walk to Palais De Chaillot and the Eiffel Tower. 15 minutes walk to Arc De Triomphe. The avenue gets very quiet after 9pm but we walked up and down Kleber 3 nights in a row and never felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent .... You should visit”
Reviews.Author: novotelAUH
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, very clean and cozy hotel. rooms are nice and bed is very comfortable. Also there is a small balcony with nice flowers. Staff are very helpful and attentive

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel near Trocadero and Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lion_10
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully grand old hotel on the Corner of Avenue Kleber, 15mins from both the Arc de Triomphe and Trocadero. Service was very good and we were upgraded to a superior room after asking for a room with a view. Whilst the room itself was stunning with a huge bed and surprisingly spacious for Paris, there was a considerable amount of road noise as the rooms are not double glazed and it overlooked the main road. The rooms on the side street do not have this problem

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget anything at the Baltimore Hotel Paris”
Reviews.Author: JDSilva1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Baltimore Holtel in Paris and the employees were nice. When I left the hotel I forgot a blouse in the closet and as soon as I got home I contacted the hotel to ask them to send the blouse to me (at my expenses of course). I was surprised because when I called, they weren't nice anymore and told me to contact the convierge by email. I did that and one day later I received the answer: they didn't find anything in the room!!! I asked them to check but they never answered me again. That means we can't forget anyhing in our rooms because they steal it!! I began to think if they hadn't stolen anything else when I was still there...

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, fantastic views from room”
Reviews.Author: southportgirl
Reviews.Content: just back tonight, fantastic location between arc de triomphe and eifell tower, walking distance even for someone like me with dodgy knees. we had room 605 and the evening view of the eifell tower was fantastic, could see almost 2/3rds of the tower with it's lights and lasers. room was smallish but then again that's paris rooms for you, but it was spotless, linen changed every day (even have a lovely bathrobe provided). only slight disappointment was the small reading area, lovely done up, very modern but very small and the lack of bar facilities for a nice evenikng glass of wine. overall if you just want to sleep in it then this hotel is fantastic. just a small warning, paris itself is exorbitant for prices, everywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: cathandpete
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as the original hotel we had booked had lost our reservation. We were very grateful for the Baltimore finding us a room at such short notice, but we thought that 190 euros a night for the room we had wasn't too great. We were given a room at the back corner of the hotel. The room itself was large, and the bathroom was also large, but the view from the window overlooked the backs of apartments, and we were next to the service lift which woke us up a few times during the nights we were there. The bathroom, although large, was a little outdated. The other 'interesting' feature was that when you emptied the sink all the water flowed UP the bidet, filling it almost to the brim - not very nice when you're trying to get a clean feeling! Another negative, certainly in this room, was the lack of storage space. There was one wardrobe with 8 hangers, not exactly enough for two people to hang their clothes. We thought we'd found some nice drawers to put the rest of our things in, but it turned out to be the fridge with false drawers (decorative). So, we ended up having to leave a lot of our things in the suitcase. There are some nice things though. The room was always clean, with fresh bed linin every day. The evening turn down service was a bonus, and it was nice to come back in after an evening out and feel instantly relaxed. We wouldn't stay here again as we feel it is very overpriced for the service and rooms that you get, but our stay was pleasent. I would recommend the hotel providing you can afford one of the more expensive rooms, I think that way you'd be in for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Bad service - 2nd class citizen”
Reviews.Author: LilianaEmilio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is suppose to be a 4 star hotel. Beautiful from the outside but no service to speak of. We had asked for a Deluxe room, when we got to the room it was a tiny little room whith no drawers or shelves. The hotel placed us in a corner next to the service elevator and one tiny window overlooking apartments - no view. The bathroom, large for Europe's standard, the shower/tub was a hike to climb into. When we asked if our room was a deluxe room another attendant was going to change us but the original attendant said no that all the rooms had been booked. Somehow it looked like we had gotten a good price on the room and he was not willing to change us.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel & Perfectly located!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: m3lexis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Baltimore is ideally located btw the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe. The rooms are small, yet very clean. Located in a quiet residential area.Highly recommend having dinner at any of the resturants located in Plaza de Trocadero.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JamesG33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baltimore Hotel for a couple of days on our first trip to Paris. My wife and I loved every aspect of the hotel - great location, friendly and helpful staff and very nice, clean, comfortable room. We took the Air France bus from the airport to the Arc de Triomphe, which is about a half mile from the hotel. (you don't have to be an Air France customer to ride this bus - very economical and it only makes one intermediate stop). We walked from there to the hotel to scope out the neighborhood. The hotel room was cozy, but comfortable and well kept. We had a superior room on the second floor with a window that overlooked the side street. It had a small balcony to enjoy, although it's a quiet street so there wasn't a lot to see. The hotel staff was very nice, particularly the concierge. He arranged a trip to the palace of Versailles for us shortly after we arrived, which took several phone calls to set it up as we were doing it at the last minute. The staff all spoke english. There is a small grocery store right around the corner from the hotel to pick up snacks and goodies (beer and wine too) if you want to save paying for room service at the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and you can catch the on-off tour bus about a block away. The first evening we walked to the Eiffel Tower. which is about three quarters of a mile away. We ate dinner at the Cafe du Trocadero (very tourist friendly staff)) located at the end of Kleber and sat at their outdoor tables after dinner to watch the tower light up. The hotel was a great place to stay for a first Paris visit. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room, great location”
Reviews.Author: SanukSanuk
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a lovely four-night stay here. The hotel is only a short walk from Tracadero and the Eiffel Tower and a 15-minute stroll to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs Elysees. Yet it's quiet enough, so that you're not disturbed by street noise, and I'm a pretty light sleeper.The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bath products were good quality. I had a junior suite which is only slightly larger than an average American hotel room. The breakfast buffet offered something for everyone from fruit and yogurt to crossaints and made-to-order omelettes. Staff were friendly and helpful. I think the rates are fair, but the devalued dollar makes it pricey for those of us traveling from the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Comfy, Non-touristy, Classy Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ValdezFamily
Reviews.Content: Although the Baltimore is not the cheapest place to stay in Paris, we keep going back. We've stayed there three times this year. We've also stayed in other cheaper and similarly priced hotels. This one has a good mix...from an American point of view. The overall quality is pretty good. Staff is quite friendly and helpful. Breakfast selection is very good, albeit expensive, which is normal for Paris. The beds are The Best in Paris...not hard but not too soft either. The rooms are on the quiet side unless in front of the elevator. Room sizes vary from snug and cozy to roomier than many European hotel rooms...depends on room type. Location is perfect. Just in front of Boisserie Metro stop...short walk from Tour Eiffel, Arc de Triomphe and Champs. The rooms are clean and the indoor air quality beats most American hotels by far. We feel comfortable and welcome when we stay at the Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive”
Reviews.Author: seaplane-lover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very pleasant as were the staff ~ we arrived and were asked to take a seat and were just left there until one of our party(of4) went to the desk and asked if there was a problem with checking in ~ we were told one of the rooms were not ready and that they would arrange for us to have drinks ~ we ordered 3 Gin & Tonics and were given a bill for 51eur = £50 by any stretch of the imagination that is a crazy price for 3 drinks~ so my advice to anyone is stay else where, there are lots of other hotels around ~ the best places to eat for variety and price is the Latin Quarter near to Notre Dame and Montmartre near the Sacre Cour ~ Paris is wonderful but don't get ripped off!

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: fl0RITA
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel. Comfortable bed. A lot of TV channels.Walking distance to Eiffel Tower and Triumph Arc,all other destinations can be easily reached by subway. Never had any breakfast or dinner in the Hotel,so can't tell anything about it. I highly recommend it!!! P.S.Do NOT go to the "Pub Kleber" right across the street from the hotel. For the small glass of fresh made OJ they charged us 10 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, helpful staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: foxworth
Reviews.Content: Great location near to the Place D'Iena, Trocadero and Champs Elysees, just across the river from the Eiffel tower. Small rooms but nice large comfy beds and good tv/bathroom etc so v comfortable. In this location it's unlikely you'd be in the hotel long anyway. Can be a little noisy on the lower floors due to deliveries etc but staff are v accommodating if you have issues.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Kanaschwiiz
Reviews.Content: Of the hotel's I've stayed with in this price class (ca. 220-280 Euros/night) in Paris this is one of the better ones. Friendly casual staff efficiently checked me in/out. Temperature controls in room worked relatively well. Flat-screen TV was cumbersome and had few channels (but had BBC news and CNN Int'l as a required minimum). Didn't have any food in the hotel. Matresses need flipping/renewing (but not any more than other Parisien hotels). It's not Asia or even North America, but for Paris it's good.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be Happier that I stayed at Hotel Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: KacieK
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 4 nights over a long weekend in Paris. After reading pages and pages of reviews on Trip Advisor and other sites looking for the "perfect" hotel, I booked the Hotel Baltimore and hoped for the best. Arriving in Paris at 7am, we took the metro to Boissiere and had a one block walk to the Hotel. The hotel is a typically French looking building with great curb appeal in a quiet, yet visitor friendly neighborhood, with several cafes and shops nearby.
