The Trocadero metro stop (Champs de Mars area) is literally at the end of the street. From this point, the view of the Eiffel Tower is stunning, and just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Upon arrival, a doorman greeted us and took our bags inside, even though we could easily have done so ourselves. Checking in was a breeze, since everyone behind the desk spoke English. We were "upgraded" to a suite and offered complimentary breakfast in the hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay-they offered to make reservations, call cabs, etc if we wanted. When we got to the room, we were on the 6th floor in a room overlooking the central courtyard. The room was incredibly spacious for what we paid for, and was recently upgraded. I did not feel like I was in a chain (Accor) hotel whatsoever. Highlights: Great bed- very comfortable! Well taken care of rooms with turn down service at night, spacious bathroom. My only complaint: the tub was quite small. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. I felt good about the service we received, and would stay here many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class - as I like it”
Reviews.Author: mst1
Reviews.Content: I am a bit sorry to hear that visitor jacandy paid such a high price for his junior suite. In the current economical context, the price you pay for a room - in any hotel - is mainly a function of your negotiation skills. I got a great deal on a junior suite for a whole week. Good room, clean, quiet, very comfortable bed. Friendly, patient and helpful staff ( I don't deserve this, as I behaved like a spoilt child, sent them on numerous errands, often had outside food delivered in the room and made a big mess). There is nothing trendy, prestigious, or special to the hotel: it seems a well-kept secret between demanding frequently returning visitors. This hotel gives you the special feeling that you own the place (and the staff :) - you're at home. Tasteful wooden decoration. Not one false note during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy upscale hotel, hurt by postage-stamp size rooms.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Classy high-end hotel, with elegant lobby, professional staff and in a posh neighborhood. An Aston-Martin Vanquish was valet'd outside the hotel's front door during my stay. Room: The only, but significant, dissapointment. Miniscule tiny room. Could barely open my suitcase as the large double/queen bed occupied almost every meter of space. Only 1 small window, overlooking the courtyard = minimal light. Bed was extremely comfortable, however, including both mattress and high-quality linens. Flat-screen cable tv. High-end bathroom fixtures (but very small!). The incredibly small size of room plus lack of natural light, unfortunately, are reason why I would not return. Just too expensive for the tiny space. Location: In the poshest of neighborhoods, between the Arch de Triumph, Champs-Elysees and Trocadero's views over the Eiffel Tower. Staff: Professional staff were accustomed to providing a higher-level of service to the discerning international traveller on business. (vs. staff at standard Paris tourist hotels. ie: no telling me "it's impossible" when I ask for a taxi, instead inviting me to have a seat in the comfortable lobby lounge, getting on the phone and making it happen; then coming to notify me when the taxi arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel ! Everybody happy!”
Reviews.Author: melusina1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a large group over 50 people for the week end. A very, very nice hotel with individual service. Luxurious lobby, gorgious hot and cold breakfast with table service for all sorts of à la minute prepared eggs. My room was definitely 5* (Junior suite, 4 floor), fantastic bed, luxurious bathroom full of little luxuries. Excellent and safe location, very close to Metro, to the Arc de Triomphe and to the Trocadero. Helpful and very friendly staff. Not really cheap but good rate for Paris. The bar was nice but astronomically expensive (€ 6,- for a glas mineral water is definitely too much!). However we will certainly recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to spend some nice days in the French capital.

Reviews.Title: “pricy but nice”
Reviews.Author: desgrant
Reviews.Content: The location is superb , so close to the Eiffe Tower, the room we were in was recently refurbished to a top 5 star standard, but judging by the other reviews not all rooms are done, also the hotel told us they were refurbishing. so insist on a refurb room. It's a very pricey hotel, 270 euro a night. Just about worth it, but shop around of other hotels , in the recession the 270 euro a night days are over...or should be. ..drinks are crazy priced. rooms average size for Paris or a little better

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Jen041
Reviews.Content: We checked in with anticipation of being given a superior room with a hot breakfast which was what we paid for. The room we were given was tiny, at the back of the hotel down a corridor, small window no view and one small chair. We had to take turns walking around the room it was so small. We went to the front desk and were offered a junior suite at extra cost which we declined. On going back to our room we discovered the safe did not work and were told we could use the one at reception. We then insisted that we be moved to a room that was suitable and within the price range for which we had paid. We were then moved to a larger room with a small balcony-very nice, lovely comfortable beds, large bathroom. Our experience of the staff was that they let the hotel down badly. The staff at breakfast would not offer the cooked breakfast and we had to insist that we wanted it as we had paid for it. We stayed for 5 days but could not bear to go to breakfast for 2 days because it was such an unpleasant experience. The location of the hotel very close to the metro and it is very quiet on weekends so dining on Sundays is a problem as everything is closed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: TARAS06
Reviews.Content: I must preface this review by saying that my husband and I are avid travelers, and have never paid so much for a hotel that was sooo lacking. On arrival to our room as the door opened we were greeted with the smell of sewage. The hotel had no problem switching us to a different room, which smelled slightly better but still had the stench of stale, mold mixed with urine. Our bathroom actually smelled like a public toilet. While the decor of the room was nice enough, there was a large piece of plaster missing from the wall, the wall paper was bubbling in many areas throughout the room, and the towels in the bathroom were dingy and unravelling. The bed did not even have a top sheet, just the duvet cover. I was extremely disappointed, disgusted, and dismayed that we spent quite a bit of money on such a low standard hotel. It was not typical of a Sofitel. This certainly in not a five, nor even a four star hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, not even for its proximity to certain sites in the city. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “A "special" treatment...”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_Kassan
Reviews.Content: Imagine a young, happy couple, returning from a wonderful romantic sojourn in an exotic location and, wanting to crown their so far spotless holiday, they book a weekend at the Sofitel Demeure Baltimore, Paris. Upon the arrival they are greeted by a very bored receptionist, Anne, by her name. Even if the reception has been notified before the couple' s arrival by a travel agent that they are in a special vacation and, thus, they desire to be given a special, cozy, room, the couple is given one of the worst rooms in the hotel... The room, in fact, is a single and belonging to an inferior class from what they have booked (and paid!). They are told that, maybe, the next morning a better room might be available, since the hotel is "fully booked". The next day, after a long series of discussions, the hotel staff agrees to make them "an upgrade" to the type of room they have actually booked. The hotel, overall, is a little bit run down and the staff not so much helpful. The breakfast is very poor and the plates are not changed so that at times you have to wait for or, eventually, to skip an assortment or another of food. The rooms, in general, are small and lack personality. The cable reception in rooms is very poor. The showers don't work properly. The only good thing about the rooms is the mattresses, but this is not a particular merit of the hotel, since it is standard in all Sofitel hotels. Now, to get back to my story... Two days after, upon the couple's departure, they have the misfortune to be serviced by the same bored receptionist, Anne, by her name. They pack their bags and call the reception to send somebody to help them with the luggage. They are said "Sure, right away, sir!" but nobody is sent. Finally, after half an hour of waiting, they go down to the reception to find out that Anne has not even asked somebody to go and help them. Even more, Anne is very rude to the couple, making a big scene in the reception in front of a puzzled audience. Here my story ends, leaving still one question opened: would you or any reasonable person be willing to pay a quite expensive amount of money per night to get such a "special" treatment?!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for value”
Reviews.Author: christoph_rooms
Reviews.Content: pro : - nice decorated - beds = ok contra : - small rooms - noisy rooms - rooms are too warm - breakfast too simple! - bathroom too small and simple. For this type of hotel you would expect a decent shower.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable priorities”
Reviews.Author: Robinwirral
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully appointed hotel in an ideal location but for a 4star+ quality hotel, the Sofitel Baltimore has unfortunately been let down by lack of attention to detail. The housekeeping inspection could be better i.e. on arrival, the shaverpoint and electronic key required fixing and the TV reception (particularly CNN) was poor. One of the lamps in the bathroom did not work and although the toiletries were superb, the hotel's priorities are questionable, as there were no bread rolls nor hot items in the buffet at breakfast,which is poor for a 4star+ hotel. Only one of the two lifts was working during our stay and the first room we were offered (as a better one) was not ready and when we finally saw it,it was up in the attic and not at all suitable as it was very small with a very small double bed rather than the twin-bedded room we had booked.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the attic :P but great staff service”
Reviews.Author: yodelingyoda
Reviews.Content: Maybe its the World Cup rugby 2007 season, but everything was so expensive. we (Wife & me on honeymoon) paid AUD$530 per person per night. for 4 nights. Our room was on top floor.... actually the attic. picture yourself a trianglar room and thats where we spent 4 nights... the better rooms costed 850EURO/person. so that was beyond our price range. Service: 5 stars ! upon arrival we were greeted with a bottle of champagne, and complimentry drinks vouchers to the bar, and a plate of fruit they service the room quite frequently. and all the staff & concerige there will go out of their way to help you with directions, book tours, direct you to the best restaurants ... whatever you want they will help you. They even serve you coffee/ Tea to your rooms if you don't go down to the breakfast rooms before 8am :P The staff also remembers your name favorite drink etc.... basically you feel like you have personalised staff tending to your every need. Location:Excellent. ! 200 meters from the Effiel Tower, 50 meters from the underground metro, arc de triumph , and if you turn left and left again from the front door, you're basically 50 meters away from the nearest supermarket and the just 200 meters from a shopping mall with another supermarket. there is a lougage store nearby if need an extra suitcase for all those shoppings *wink* * * * Choose a room that is not facing the main street, because it does get very noisy ! the hotel faces Three street, the main street is Keblar or something, choose the opposite side for your room, its a lot quieter. * * * Food : well , breakfast is ok, not as much variety as other hotels that we've been to. coffee is really good. but we didn't saw a ROACH in the toast basket one morning ..... :( Dinner there was really bad. DON'T even attempt the Shrimp/Leek entree ! you will be seriously ill by the smell. for 260 Euro it was the worst dinner we've ever tasted. everything tasted so bad. There is another resturant If you turn left from the hotel, its awesome. the concerige will direct you. if you want snail, the bistro to the right of hotel offers them, the chicken there is quite good too. Internet / business center is down stairs, but only 1 PC so quite busy. In general we had quite a good time in paris. The hotel is quite expensive , but from what i heard unless you want to pay 800 ~ 1000 euro per night, Paris is very expensive so hotel rooms are usually very very small. In general a really good hotel, but for your own safety avoid eating dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Fabulous location, We loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: Sparktwinkle
Reviews.Content: We went here in March and it was a little rainy but it was wonderful. The Hotel is off Klebar(sp*) Which is right near to the Arc de Triumphe The room was a new modern design, and it was fabulous. It was lovely and spacious. It was very clean and it very much exceeded our expectations. We also treated ourself to a night at the Moulan Rouge (which our conceirge arranged and bagged us the very best seats with no extra cost). I recommend the Champers and dinner at the Rouge ( not to be missed .. when in paris lol) The food at this Hotel was excellent - the food is by far the best food that I have ever had the pleasure to experience, This hotel is the perfect place to stay at when in paris. You are 5 min walk from the Eiffel Tower (where you can board the batobus glass boat and visit the lourve and all the other top tourist spots, also very reasonably priced and run all day long) The staff were all wonderful and very helpful. We cannot fault this hotel at all. This for us was 10/10. I recommend that anyone stay here, for you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kealoha12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline, and like other reviewers we were offered an upgrade. We took the upgrade which had more square footage because it was the last leg of our trip and we thought we'd splurge. Plus it gave our toddler more room to spread his toys out. I won't say it was worth the cost (an extra $70 a night) but I'm glad we had a bigger room. The standard room was just about the right size for a city like Paris--I've stayed in smaller hotels in New York. Like any 4+ star hotel, the costs of some services was astounding--for instance, if you want to have your laundry done its 8 euros for ONE shirt! Needless to say we opted another route (a good friend lives in the city so I ended up doing laundry at her place). I was offered an internet service--15 euros for 10 hours which was more than adequate for the 5 days we were there for checking emails and looking for places to go. The staff was excellent---very friendly and spoke very good English. They were always helpful. The bed was the most comfortable in our entire 16 days in Europe--very similar to our own bed at home which to me made the price of the hotel worth it (a little over $300 a night). The location was excellent. It is within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Arc d'Triomphe, Champs Elysee, and several metro lines. In fact a metro stop is just across from the hotel. We loved the cafes and restaurants. Every single one we entered was full of locals and the food excellent. My only complaint is that the hotel seems to cater more to businessmen--all the complimentary toiletry were more suited for men. The lobby at the end of the day had business men sitting and smoking. Since I did not hang out in the lobby the smoking didn't really bother me. My husband and I are planning to return (without the toddler) soon and we'll most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality not quantity”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTechnoLawyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel Baltimore from March 14 to March 18, 2007. We booked the Hotel on Priceline (bidding on the 4+ star category, with a bid of $210.00 U.S. per night with service fees and taxes it was $225). We had previously stayed at another Sofitel in London. Upon arrival we were offered a choice of two upgrades either from a standard to a superior room for 30 Euros per night or from a standard to a Junior Suite for 100 Euros per night. Apparently the strategy is to convert the Priceline traveller to a higher revenue guest. We were advised the Standard room is really designed for a single traveller but can accomodate two adults. The room was small about 11 x 13 feet for the bedroom plus a small bathroom. Given that Priceline describes the room as being suited for two adults this was a little bit of a let down. That being said everything in the room (except the television which appeared to be a 20 inch CRT [tube] set) was of the highest quality. The bed was superb, and the linens were outstanding. The design was contempory. The furniture small but of first rate qualtiy. The location is excellent. Just cross the street and go seventy steps further and you are in a metro station. EASY. The Eifel tower is an easy walk and the Arc de Triumph is moderate walk. If you use the internet in your room or in the business center you are going to pay a pretty penny. Thirty minutes (not even an hour) in the business center runs 10 Euros. The hotel had an appropriate quanity of staff, all of whom spoke English, and were both professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: minty_me
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my spouse for one night in February 2007. The room was very small, but that's pretty much to be expected in a standard Paris hotel room. The room and bathroom were extremely clean, with nice basic furnishings/linens that looked newish and well taken cared of. Our only complaint was the terribly uncomfortable mattress. Our 6th floor room had a postage-stamp sized roof terrace - no great view, but it did have a flowerbox and plenty of fresh air. The staff (from the maid to the check-in staff and concierge) were all quite pleasant and helpful. The location is decent, near the Metro and with a bus stop out front (line 30 direct from Gares du Nord and l'Est). Walk 10 minutes up the street and you're at the Arc d'Triomphe, 10 minutes down the street and you're at the Trocadero/Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2bundles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in December. The staff were very helpful, even booked shows for us etc. The breakfast was included in our rate and was delicious. We were originally given a very small room; however we upgraded with our Accor loyalty card to a really nice room with a king size bed and a largish bathroom. The room was a little dark, but had a nice big window which could open. The location is excellent. Bed is one of the best I have ever slept in. Standard rooms are too small for more than 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Awful...tiny rooms, smokey smell”
Reviews.Author: cttravelor
Reviews.Content: Hotel was small and smokey smelling. Our room was not ready upon arrival and we were put in a small room over a delivery entrance. Noise began at 4:00am and didn't stop until 6:30am. The room was so small we could not open the bathroom door all the way without hitting the bed. The hotel smelled like smoke. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: badgb21
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a ‘classic room’ on the Sofitel web site. We arrived late at night and were given room 319 On entry to the room we realised it was extremely small. We called the desk to be changed, but no answer, so decided to shower and sleep. The room was only set up for single occupancy, with one bathrobe and one pair of slippers etc. In the morning we were offered another room after being told that the ‘classic room’ was a single room, with a maximum occupancy of 2 people….work that one out! Following much arm twisting we were given complimentary breakfast too for the inconvenience. The hotel is in a great location, with many attractions in walking distance. However, I’d suggest staying at the Sofitel Le Parc in preference to the Baltimore, similar location, but better rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Baltimore Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 88 bis avenue Kleber | 16 Arr., 75116 Paris, France
